node.title: Is it possible to be content renting long-term? This is what Australia can learn from housing around the world
node.alt: A close up of Gloria Biberger with her partner looking over her shoulder as they sit in a rowboat.
node.description: Imagine having capped rent increases, long-term leases and eviction security that helped make your rented property feel like your own home. This is what other countries are doing to help address the housing crisis.
node.content:
["Gloria Biberger has been renting the same apartment in Berlin's lively Kreuzberg neighbourhood for 11 years.", "And despite being a tenant, she says,\u00a0\"it feels like my home\".", "\"I know that I could stay here forever,\" the 37-year-old said.", "Typically,\u00a0tenants in Germany have freedom of decoration, with older\u00a0and cheaper\u00a0apartments even requiring you to bring your own\u00a0light fixtures\u00a0and kitchen sink.\u00a0", "\"I want to feel very comfortable in my own home,\" Ms Biberger said.", "\"That's why it's important that I can furnish and decorate\u00a0it myself; I really want to feel like it's my own thing.\"", "While Ms Biberger is happy in her current apartment, where under her open-ended lease she can only be evicted in\u00a0very restricted circumstances \u2013\u00a0even if the apartment was sold \u2013\u00a0she's on the\u00a0hunt for a bigger place with her partner.", "The couple hope\u00a0to\u00a0rent their next apartment for at least the next 10 years and have no\u00a0desire to buy a property in the foreseeable future.", "", "
Ms Biberger has been in the same rented apartment for 11 years and says she could have stayed indefinitely.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "With strong tenant protections and unlimited\u00a0leases, Ms Biberger is among the many Germans who remain content to rent.", "More than 80 per cent of Berlin's 3.7 million residents rent their home.", "Across the country, the home ownership rate stands at about 50 per cent, which is one of the lowest in Europe, according to market and consumer data firm Statista.", "Despite rents increasing more substantially in recent years, Ms Biberger still feels better off renting than if she owned a home.", "\"Friends who have moved to the countryside to buy homes are envious when I tell them I'm going to the United States and travelling,\" she said.", "", "
Germany's laws are broadly in favour of the tenant with long leases and strict eviction requirements allowing renters to stay put long-term.\u00a0(Reuters: Annegret Hilse)
", "
A rethink of rights for Australia's\u00a0long-term renters
", "Australia's obsession with home ownership has become a pipe dream for many, with\u00a0skyrocketing rents making it near impossible for long-term renters to save for a home.", "This year, tenants experienced their biggest annual rent increases since 2009, while house prices have been climbing twice as fast.", "Housing experts say Australia is falling behind in providing a coordinated policy structure that offers stronger renter protections,\u00a0long-term stability, and adequate\u00a0funding for social housing.\u00a0", "\"We haven't had a national coordinated housing policy in Australia since 1992,\" said Swinburne University professor of housing policy\u00a0Wendy Stone.", "Although there's no model that can just be \"picked off the shelf of another country\", there are a range of approaches that Australia could look to in order to reduce rental stress and improve the housing market overall.", "Chris Martin, research fellow at the UNSW City Futures Research Centre, said a starting point was a rethink of renters'\u00a0rights.", "Getting rid of no grounds terminations is \"the simplest thing that governments could do tomorrow\", he said.\u00a0", "Victoria, Tasmania and the ACT have recently made changes to eviction laws, but across much of the country booming rental prices have\u00a0led to an increase in tenants being evicted without cause.", "", "
The average price of an 84-square metre apartment in Seoul is roughly $950,000, according to local experts.\u00a0(ABC News: Mitch Denman Woolnough)
", "In particular, Mr Martin said states and territories should\u00a0be looking at rent regulation and rental affordability, which were issues missing from the recent residential tenancies law reviews.", "\"We don't have any regulation of rents for affordability across Australia,\" he said.", "In recent months, Ireland, Scotland\u00a0and Spain announced rent controls and laws that cap annual rent increases.", "In 2020, South Korea also\u00a0introduced a range of stronger tenant protections, including limiting rent increases to 5 per cent,\u00a0amid a staggering rise in real estate prices.", "In US\u00a0cities such as New York and San Francisco rent control is hardly new.\u00a0", "Mr Martin said there were\u00a0some regulations across states and territories that prevented\u00a0landlords from increasing rent more than once in six or 12 months, but it could\u00a0be increased at the market level.", "\"A tenant can challenge a rent increase if it's excessive to the general market level of rents, but if the general market level of rent is going up 20 per cent in a year, that's the sort of rent increase a landlord can give,\" he said.", "Berlin took\u00a0a more controversial approach in\u00a0January 2020, freezing the city's rents at mid-2019 levels for five years.", "The law also stipulated that any rents that were in 20 per cent excess of a standardised level would have to be reduced.", "But the move\u00a0was short\u00a0lived after the country's conservative political parties\u00a0challenged the law and a court ruled it was unconstitutional.", "Protests broke out in the streets following the decision, and renters across the country continue to stage regular demonstrations\u00a0voicing anger over rising rents.\u00a0", "
Singapore sets the standard for public housing
", "In Singapore, where there's a strong focus on public\u00a0housing,\u00a0more than 80 per cent of the island's 5.4 million residents own a home.", "A scheme was introduced in the 1960s to provide affordable, high-quality housing for residents through the\u00a0Housing and Development Board (HDB).", "The highly subsidised apartments were purchased on 99-year leases from the HDB, often financed with an individuals' Central Provident Fund (CPF).", "A CPF works like superannuation in Australia, with up to 20 per cent of a person's salary going into a CPF account, which can't be touched unless being used for a mortgage.", "", "
Mr Yip says he's grateful there's a system in place that enables most Singaporeans to own their own home.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "Ken Yip used his\u00a0CPF to buy a HDB apartment, which he moved into with his wife and two cats in October.", "The 37-year-old had been living with his parents until he was able to accumulate enough funds to buy a four-room apartment.", "\"They [the buildings]\u00a0are quite nice and all very tall, obviously in Singapore because of land mass,\" Mr Yip said.", "\"The government also ensures that they are equipped with amenities, like basic clinics, convenience stores, and laundromats.\"", "", "
My Yip and his wife purchased a four-bedroom\u00a0resale HDB apartment.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "There are tight rules governing ownership and resale of the\u00a0apartments.\u00a0", "The minimum occupancy period is five years;\u00a0after that the owner can sell the apartment with the\u00a0resale value deteriorating as the lease end date approaches.", "\"Singapore is amazing for this combination of public provision, public development and home ownership,\" Mr Martin said.", "\"We used to build a lot more social housing and for a time it was also part of the reason why Australian owner occupation was as high as it was.\"", "
Social housing on a 'starvation ration'
", "A recent report by researchers from the UNSW and the Australia Council of Social Service (ACOSS) found that more than 400,000 households needed affordable housing.\u00a0", "It said governments in Victoria, Queensland, Tasmania and Western Australia had\u00a0committed to self-funded public housing projects worth nearly $10 billion, set to deliver 23,000 homes.", "However, the federal government needed to resume its \"historical role\" as the main funder of social housing developments.", "\"They need to commit to funding a subsidy that will allow states to develop social housing in a way that meets community needs for affordable rental housing.\"", "", "
Tall public housing buildings in Singapore have been provided as desirable and affordable living options since the 1960s.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "The federal minister for Homeless, Social and Community Housing, Michael Sukkar, said the government was making \"significant\u00a0inroads to support social and affordable housing\".", "The National Housing Financing and Investment Corporation (NHFIC) has supported more than 13,000 social and affordable properties since it was established in 2018, through more than $2.5 billion of low-cost loans to community housing providers, he said.\u00a0", "The government was expected to spend about $9 billion on housing and homelessness in the upcoming financial year.", "The federal opposition has also pledged to\u00a0establish a $10 billion future fund to build social and affordable housing with a target of 30,000 dwellings in five years.\u00a0", "
A push for longer leases\u00a0
", "When Ireland passed legislation earlier in the year capping rent increases at 2 per cent annually, it also addressed long-term security by introducing \"tenancies of unlimited duration\".", "While the majority of Australian renters are on fixed, short-term leases, multi-year or open-ended leases are common in countries including France, Japan, the Netherlands, Germany and Spain.", "\"Six or 12-month\u00a0leases\u00a0don't enable people to really get a foothold and live\u00a0life well,\u00a0particularly if they have children or families,\"\u00a0Professor Stone\u00a0said.", "\"It's really insecure and counterproductive in very many ways.\"\u00a0", "She said\u00a0more thought was needed to providing long-term secure housing that reflected\u00a0the aspirations of Australians\u00a0to be productive, healthy and engaged in society.\u00a0\u00a0", "", "
The pandemic has exacerbated the rental crisis in many major cities across the world with governments attempting to cool the market with stronger tenant protections.\u00a0(Reuters: Clodagh Kilcoyne)
", "
Increasing threat of big landlords\u00a0
", "The pandemic has intensified Australia's housing crisis, in particular housing inequality.", "Professor Stone warned that reforms need to target a \"snowballing of wealth and asset accumulation\", which the country's taxation settings were currently enabling.\u00a0", "\"Low\u00a0interest rates are supporting some first homeowners, but actually\u00a0it's also very much supporting repeat investors as well,\" she said.", "\"So people are building up a portfolio while other people are missing out on any kind of shelter at all.\"", "Globally there are also examples of regulation that specifically targets large-scale investment funds buying\u00a0multiple properties\u00a0across major cities.\u00a0", "\"Currently we have a situation where international global investment funds can effectively buy whole apartment blocks and they're not necessarily even housing people in them because it can be cheaper to leave them empty,\" she said.", "\"It's something that\u00a0cities around the world, including Barcelona, London and Stockholm, are starting to realise the scale of and the negative impact it's having on their communities.\"", "Berlin's citizens voted in September to expropriate properties from big landlords to reduce rents, targeting companies holding 3,000 or more apartments", "In Canada,\u00a0Prime Minister Justin Trudeau made a re-election campaign pledge to introduce a two-year ban on foreign home buyers to tackle housing shortages and affordability."]
